q: What is web server performance tuning?
o: Optimizing server configuration for speed and efficiency

q: Performance tuning aims to reduce response ______.

o: Algorithm that reduces file size for transfer
Reusing TCP connections for multiple requests
Storing data temporarily for faster access

q: Caching improves response time for repeated requests.
Content-Encoding: gzip tells client response is ______.
Clients send Accept-Encoding to request compression.
Deflate is generally less widely supported than ______.

o: Modern compression with better ratios than gzip

q: Brotli typically achieves 15-25% better compression than gzip.
no-cache still allows caching but requires validation.

o: Response can be cached by any cache

q: Public caching allows CDNs to cache the response.
Private caching is suitable for user-specific ______.

o: Date when cached content becomes stale

q: Last-Modified helps browsers decide if cache is fresh.
304 Not Modified is returned if content unchanged.

o: Resource has not changed since last request
Amount of data held in memory before processing

q: More worker processes utilize more CPU ______.

o: Group of threads available to handle requests

q: Thread pools reduce overhead of creating new threads.

o: Maximum wait time before closing connection
Maximum time to wait for complete request
Maximum time for backend to respond

q: Response timeout helps handle slow backends.

o: Disables Nagle's algorithm for faster sends

q: TCP_NODELAY reduces latency for small packets.

o: Combines small packets to reduce overhead

q: TCP_CORK is used with sendfile for optimal transfer.

o: Allows multiple processes to bind same port
Caching files that don't change frequently

q: Static files include CSS, JavaScript, and images.

o: Removing whitespace and comments from code
Content Delivery Network for distributed caching

q: CDN serves content from geographically close servers.

o: Caching at network edge near users

q: Edge caching reduces ______ to origin server.

o: Proxy server caches responses from origin

q: Reverse proxy reduces load on backend servers.

o: Measure of how fast page loads

q: Page speed affects user experience and ______.

o: Time To First Byte - server response time

q: Lower TTFB indicates faster server response.

o: First Contentful Paint - first visible content

q: FCP measures when user first sees ______.

o: Largest Contentful Paint - main content load time

q: LCP should be under 2.5 seconds for good UX.
Throttling prevents single users from consuming all ______.

o: Tells caches which request headers affect response

q: Vary: Accept-Encoding caches separate versions for each ______.
s-maxage only applies to shared caches like CDNs.

o: Serve stale while fetching fresh content
Serve stale if origin returns error

q: Immutable prevents revalidation requests for ______ content.

o: Must check with origin when stale

q: no-transform prevents image optimization by proxies.

o: Trade-off between compression ratio and CPU
Files smaller than threshold are not compressed

q: Very small files may become larger after compression.
What is MIME type filtering for compression?
Images and videos are usually already ______.

o: Server sends resources before client requests

q: Server push can preload CSS and JavaScript files.
HPACK maintains header table for efficiency.
CSS typically has higher priority than ______.
HTTP/3 uses UDP instead of TCP.
0-RTT allows sending data without handshake delay.
Link rel=preload hints browser to fetch early.
Prefetch downloads resources user might need ______.
Preconnect saves DNS, TCP, and TLS time.
Resource hints include preload, prefetch, and preconnect.
CSS and synchronous JS are render blocking.

o: Script loads parallel and executes when ready
Script loads parallel and executes after parsing
Reducing image size while maintaining quality

q: WebP format typically provides 25-35% better compression than ______.

o: Different image sizes for different viewports

q: srcset attribute provides multiple image sources.

o: Modern image format with best compression

q: Code splitting enables loading only needed JavaScript.

o: Tool for visualizing JavaScript bundle size

q: Bundle analyzer helps identify large dependencies.

o: Storing data in RAM for fast access

q: Memory cache is faster but more ______.
Redis supports various data structures for caching.

o: Removing or updating stale cache entries

q: Cache invalidation is one of the hardest problems in computing.

o: Many requests hitting origin when cache expires

q: OPcache is included with PHP by default.

o: Caching parts of a page separately

q: Fragment caching is useful for dynamic pages with static ______.
Full page cache is suitable for static content.

o: JavaScript for offline caching and background sync
Serve from cache, fallback to network

q: Cache-first is best for static assets.

o: Try network first, fallback to cache
Serve stale immediately, update cache in background
Cumulative Layout Shift - visual stability metric

q: CLS should be less than ______ for good experience.

o: Interaction to Next Paint - responsiveness metric

q: INP replaced First Input Delay in Core Web Vitals.

o: JavaScript tasks blocking main thread over 50ms
Schedules work during browser idle periods

q: Idle callbacks prevent blocking user interactions.

o: Delays execution until pause in events

q: Throttling ensures maximum one call per ______.
Virtual scrolling improves performance for large lists.
Web workers cannot access the DOM.

o: Using same TCP connection for multiple requests
Sending multiple requests without waiting for responses

q: HTTP/1.1 pipelining is rarely used due to head-of-line blocking.
Read timeout protects against slow backends.
Write timeout prevents hanging on slow ______.
Larger socket buffers help high-bandwidth connections.
Epoll efficiently handles many concurrent connections.
kqueue is the preferred method on ______.
Select() has limited scalability for many connections.

o: Storing backend response before sending to client

q: Header buffer should fit entire response header.

o: Number and size of buffers for response body

q: More buffers allow larger responses to be ______.

o: Buffer size that can be sent while reading

q: Busy buffers enable concurrent read and write.

o: Overflow storage when buffers are full

q: Temp files handle responses larger than buffer ______.
Upstream keepalive reduces backend connection overhead.
Round-robin is the default load balancing method.

o: Routes to server with fewest active connections

q: Least connections adapts to varying request ______.
What is IP hash load balancing?
o: Routes based on client IP address
Assigns more traffic to higher capacity servers

q: Weight of 2 receives twice as many ______.
Health checks remove failed servers from rotation.
Passive checks detect failures during normal ______.

o: Periodic probes to verify server health

q: Active checks find problems before user traffic.

o: Failures before server is marked down
Duration server stays unavailable after failures

q: After fail_timeout, server is tried again.

o: Gradually increasing traffic to recovered server
Server used only when primary servers fail
Routing user consistently to same server

q: Sticky sessions maintain session state across requests.

o: Using cookie to track server assignment

q: Consistent hashing reduces cache miss when scaling.
Graceful restart loads new config without downtime.
Traffic switches from blue to green instantly.

o: Gradual rollout to subset of users
Updating servers one at a time

q: Rolling updates maintain capacity during deployment.

o: Comparing two versions with different user groups

q: Feature flags enable runtime feature control.
Exponential backoff doubles wait time each retry.

o: Sending duplicate requests to multiple servers

q: Hedging improves latency at cost of resources.
Collapsing reduces backend load for popular ______.
Priority queues ensure critical requests are handled.
Load shedding maintains service for remaining ______.

o: Adjusting rate limits based on conditions

q: Adaptive throttling responds to system load.
Token bucket allows bursts up to bucket ______.

o: Fixed rate output regardless of input

q: Leaky bucket smooths out traffic bursts.
What is sliding window rate limiting?
Sliding window avoids burst at window ______.
Redis is commonly used for distributed rate limiting.

o: Slowing down producer when consumer overwhelmed

q: Trace ID correlates logs across services.

o: Unit of work in a trace

q: Spans show time spent in each ______.

o: Logs in machine-readable format like JSON
Latency at given percentile of requests

q: Tail latency often indicates resource contention.
SLA breach typically has financial consequences.
Exhausted error budget halts new feature ______.

o: Encrypted session state stored on client

q: Session tickets eliminate server-side session storage.

o: Server provides certificate status with response
Path from server certificate to root CA

q: Cipher suites include key exchange, encryption, and ______.

o: Key compromise doesn't expose past sessions
Latest TLS version with improved security
Forces browser to use HTTPS only

q: HSTS header prevents protocol downgrade attacks.

o: Including domain in browser's built-in list
Random value allowing specific inline scripts

q: X-XSS-Protection is largely obsolete with CSP.

o: Controls what referrer info is sent
OPTIONS request to check CORS policy

q: Chunked encoding enables sending before content size is known.
Multiple ranges are separated by boundaries.
103 allows sending hints before final response.
Retry-After is used with 429 and 503 responses.

o: Upstream did not respond in time

q: proxy_pass is used for reverse proxy configuration.

o: Timeout for reading response from backend

q: Read timeout applies to time between reads.

o: Timeout for sending request to backend

q: Send timeout applies to time between ______.
Access logs help analyze traffic patterns.

o: Archiving old logs and starting new files

q: Log rotation prevents disk space exhaustion.
Conditional logging can exclude health check requests.
Higher somaxconn helps during traffic bursts.

o: Adds timing info to TCP packets

q: SACK improves recovery from packet loss.

o: Adjusts sending rate to avoid overload

q: BBR is a modern congestion control algorithm.

o: Bottleneck Bandwidth and RTT congestion control

q: CUBIC uses cubic function for window adjustment.

o: Modern HTTP benchmarking tool with Lua scripting

q: wrk supports scripting for custom requests.
hey replaced the deprecated boom tool.

o: Modern load testing tool with JavaScript

q: Locust defines user behavior in Python code.

o: Apache load testing tool with GUI
HTTP load testing tool in Go

q: vegeta can output results in various ______.
File cache reduces disk I/O for static files.
Limiting chunk size prevents single transfer ______.

o: Bypasses kernel buffer cache for large files

q: DirectIO is useful for files larger than memory.
use epoll selects epoll for Linux.
Short resolver timeout improves failover speed.

o: Defines cache storage location and settings

q: levels parameter defines cache directory structure.

o: Sets cache duration by status code

q: Cache lock queues requests for same resource.

o: Updates cache in background while serving stale

q: Background update provides fast response with fresh content.

o: Conditions to not store response in cache

q: Slice enables partial cache for large ______.

o: Applies rate limit after specified bytes
Creates variables based on client IP
Creates variables based on other variables
Gets real client IP from proxy headers
Trusted proxy addresses for real IP

q: Only trusted proxies should be in set_real_ip_from.
stub_status shows active connections and requests.
health_check sends periodic probes to upstreams.

o: Queues requests when upstreams are busy

q: Queue prevents request rejection during bursts.
uWSGI cache stores Python application responses.
Memcached module provides simple key-value lookup.
Redis2 module enables caching with Redis ______.
srcache works with memcached and Redis.
Header filter runs before sending response.
log_by_lua enables sending logs to external systems.
